page.title: Navigating to Study Task Summary in Rave EDC

ac:layout-cell.p: The Study Task Summary section displays details and pending tasks for a study. The summary statistics display depends on the navigational level, role, and your privileges. The task summary for a study can be further filtered for tasks that are related to the object the user is viewing.

ol.li: Navigate to Rave EDC home page.

li.p:
Select a study.
The Study page displays a task summary for the selected study. Each task entry in the summary shows a count of all the entities that are one level below the current level, at the site level.

ac:structured-macro.ac:rich-text-body:
Note: A collapse
or expand
icon next to the Task Summary label gives you an option to expand or collapse the entire list. Collapsing the list during routine use of Rave EDC significantly improves page response time. Default setting displays the collapse icon and the task summary list.

li.p:
Click expand
for the selected task summary to view the detailed task list.
An item on the task list includes the site name. The tasks are paginated for each task category.

ac:structured-macro.ac:rich-text-body: Note: The task summary only includes sites that are within the user's site group assignment.

ol.li: Click the appropriate site to view task summary by subjects.

Click the pop-up
to view an expanded task list in a pop-up window.
The pop-up window displays the subject name and the folder name-form name. The task list in the pop-up window refreshes every time a form is saved. If a task no longer applies to a form, the task is removed from the list and the page count updates.
Click a subject to go to the form.

ac:layout-cell.p: The following information appears in the Study Task Summary based on your permissions:

td.p: Requiring Signature
Includes sites that have subjects with forms that require signature.
Non-Conformant Data
Includes sites that have subjects with forms that have non-conformant data.
Requiring Coding
Includes sites that have subjects with forms where at least one field on the form requires coding.
Requiring Translation
Includes sites that have subjects with forms where at least one field on the form requires translation.
Open Queries
Includes sites that have subjects with forms where at least one field on the form has an open query that is unanswered.
Answered Queries
Includes sites that have subjects with forms where at least one field on the form has an open query that is answered, but not closed.
Sticky Notes
Includes sites that have subjects with forms where at least one field on the form has a sticky note that is pending acknowledgement.
Requiring Review
Includes sites that have subjects with forms where at least one field on the form requires review.
Requiring Verification
Includes sites that have subjects with forms where at least one field on the form requires verification.
Overdue Data
Includes sites that have subjects with forms that have data with an overdue status.
Ready for Entry Lock
Includes sites that have subjects with forms where any field on the form that can be frozen is ready to be entry-locked.
Ready for Data Lock
Includes sites that have subjects with forms where any field on the form that can be frozen is ready to be hard-locked.
Cancel Queries
Includes sites that have subjects with forms where at least one field on the form has an open query that can be cancelled.

p.ac:placeholder: Update the below Macro to list all content labeled with your desired concept and the label 'task'.
Update the below Macro to list all content with your product's label, and 'concept'.

page.title: Navigating to Site Task Summary in Rave EDC

ac:layout-cell.p: The Site Task Summary section displays all tasks for the user within the selected site based on navigational level, role, and user privileges.

li.p:
Navigate to a Study > Site.
The Site page displays a task summary for the selected site. Each task entry in the summary shows a count of all the entities that are one level below the current level, a count of all subjects at the site level.

ac:structured-macro.ac:rich-text-body:
Note: A collapse
or expand
icon next to the Task Summary label gives you an option to expand or collapse the entire list. Collapsing the list during routine use of Rave EDC significantly improves page response time. Default setting is to display the collapse icon and the task summary list.

ol.li:
Click expand
for the task summary to view the details.
Click a subject to view details on the selected subject or the folder-form page.

li.p:
You can also click the pop-up icon
to view the expanded task list in a pop-up window.
The task list on the pop-up window refreshes every time a form is saved. If a task no longer applies to a form, the task is removed from the list and the page count updates.

ul.li: The subject name and the form-folder name on the pop-up window display as links that can help you navigate to the Subject page or the folder-form page for the subject.

In case of a task entry requiring signature in the task summary, there may be a discrepancy between the number of subjects showing Requiring Signature at the Study Site task summary drilldown list and the list that displays in the pop-up window. This is because the pop-up window only displays subjects that have specific forms marked as requiring signature. If there are subjects or folders marked as requiring signature, they display in the drilldown list but not in the pop-up window.

ac:layout-cell.p: The following information can appear in the Site Task Summary based on the user's role permissions:

td.p: Requiring Signature
Includes subjects who have forms that have data that is entered and requires signature.
Non Conformant Data
Includes subjects who have forms that have non-conformant data.
Requiring Coding
Includes subjects who have forms where at least one field on the form requires coding.
Requiring Translation
Includes subjects who have forms where at least one field on the form requires translation.
Open Queries
Includes subjects who have forms where at least one field on the form has an open query that is unanswered.
Answered Queries
Includes subjects who have forms where at least one field on the form has an open query that is answered but is not closed.
Sticky Notes
Includes subjects who have forms where at least one field on the form has a sticky note that is pending acknowledgement.
Requiring Review
Includes subjects who have forms where at least one field on the form requires review.
Requiring Verification
Includes subjects who have forms where at least one field on the form requires verification.
Overdue Data
Includes subjects who have forms that has data with an overdue status. In other words, the date is in the past.
Ready for Entry Lock
Includes subjects who have forms where at least one field on the form that can be frozen is ready to be entry-locked.
Ready for Data Lock
Includes subjects who have forms where any field on the form that can be frozen is ready to be hard-locked.
Cancel Queries
Includes subjects who have forms where any field on the form has an open query that can be cancelled.

p.ac:placeholder: Update the below Macro to list all content labeled with your desired concept and the label 'task'.
Update the below Macro to list all content with your product's label, and 'concept'.

page.title: Navigating to Subject Task Summary in Rave EDC

ac:layout-cell.p: The Subject Task Summary section displays all tasks for the user within the selected site based on navigational level, role, and user privileges.

ac:structured-macro.ac:rich-text-body: Note: The folder status is calculated based on the status of all the forms that belong in the folder. Within a folder, there might be forms that are hidden based on role permissions. The status of these hidden forms also contribute to the folder status. For example, you may see a folder that is non-conformant, but none of the forms under the folder that you can see may have a non-conformant status. This is because some of the hidden forms are non-conformant.

span.style: color: rgb(0,0,0);text-transform: none;text-indent: 0.0px;letter-spacing: normal;word-spacing: 0.0px;float: none;display: inline;white-space: normal;font-size-adjust: none;font-stretch: normal;background-color: rgb(255,255,255);

ol.li:
Navigate to a Study > Site > Subject.
The Subject page displays a subject task summary. Each task in the summary shows a count of all the entities that are one level below the current level, a count of forms for the subject. For example, the count for Ready for Entry Lock data is the number of forms for the subject where any field on the form that can be locked is ready to be entry-locked.

li.p:
Click the expand
for a selected task summary item to view the detailed task list.

ac:structured-macro.ac:rich-text-body:
Note: A collapse
or expand
icon next to the Task Summary label gives the user an option to expand or collapse the entire list. Collapsing the list during routine use of Rave EDC significantly improves page response time. Default setting displays the collapse icon and the task summary list.

li.p: Click any Folder-Form to view further details.

You can also click the pop-up icon
to view the expanded task list in a pop-up window.
The task list on the pop-up window refreshes every time a form is saved. If a task no longer applies to a form, the task is removed from the list and the page count updates.

ac:structured-macro.ac:rich-text-body: Note: If there is a task entry Requiring Signature in task summary section, the pop-up window only displays subjects that have specific forms marked as requiring signature.

span.style: color: rgb(0,0,0);text-transform: none;text-indent: 0.0px;letter-spacing: normal;word-spacing: 0.0px;float: none;display: inline;white-space: normal;font-size-adjust: none;font-stretch: normal;background-color: rgb(255,255,255);

color: rgb(0,0,0);text-transform: none;text-indent: 0.0px;letter-spacing: normal;word-spacing: 0.0px;float: none;display: inline;white-space: normal;font-size-adjust: none;font-stretch: normal;background-color: rgb(255,255,255);

p.span: The following tasks may appear in the Subject Task Summary section based on your permissions:

td.p: Requiring Signature
Includes forms for the subject that have data that is entered and requires signature.
Non Conformant Data
Includes forms for the subject that have non-conformant data.
Requiring Coding
Includes forms for the subject where at least one field on the form requires coding.
Requiring Translation
Includes forms for the subject where at least one field on the form requires translation.
Open Queries
Includes forms for the subject where at least one field on the form has an open query that is unanswered.
Answered Queries
Includes forms for the subject where at least one field on the form has an open query that is answered but is not closed.
Sticky Notes
Includes forms for the subject where at least one field on the form has a sticky note that is pending acknowledgement.
Requiring Review
Includes forms for the subject where at least one field on the form requires review.
Requiring Verification
Includes forms for the subject where at least one field on the form requires verification.
Overdue Data
Includes forms for the subject that has data with an overdue status. In other words, the date is in the past.
Ready for Entry Lock
Includes forms for the subject where any field on the form that can be frozen is ready to be entry-locked.
Ready for Data Lock
Includes forms for the subject where any field on the form that can be frozen is ready to be hard-locked.
Cancel Queries
Includes forms for the subject where at least one field on the form has an open query that can be cancelled.

p.ac:placeholder: Update the below Macro to list all content labeled with your desired concept and the label 'task'.
Update the below Macro to list all content with your product's label, and 'concept'.

page.title: Viewing Subject Information in Rave EDC

ac:layout-cell.p: This article is an overview of the Subject Home page in Rave EDC.
The Subject Header contains data fields that are configured as subject header fields. The header fields cannot be edited and only show fields that you have permission to view.
ac:layout-cell.h1: 5 Updating Forms in the Subject Matrix
ac:layout-cell.p:
The Subject Matrix on the left pane is a list of links to a subject's folders and forms that have to be filled out. These folders and forms are defined for a particular study and together form a matrix. When a new subject is added to a study, Rave EDC assigns a default matrix to the subject. Forms within each folder must be completed for each subject participating in the study. When data is added to the forms, each folder displays a status icon. See
Icons List
for more information.

p.strong: To update forms in the subject matrix:

ol.li:
Click a folder name in the Subject Matrix.
The forms for the folder appear.
Select a form from the left pane, and enter the required data in the form.
Click Save.

ac:layout-cell.p: Depending on your permissions, the CRF History on the left pane displays the last 10 CRFs accessed in the current session. The list shows the form name together with the subject name.

ul.li: Each form is a link in the CRF History. Click to navigate to the specific form.

ac:layout-cell.p: The Subject Summary on the left pane displays key information on the subject, such as subject identifier, subject initials, and other information that you have permission to view.
The subject summary displays:

ul.li: Data fields that are requested by the study sponsor.
Data field labels indicating whether or not data is entered for the selected subject for that particular field.

ac:layout-cell.p: Your access to subjects in Rave is restricted based on the subject status in the study and your permission to work with subjects of a certain status. For example, if a subject's status in a study is set to Screened, Randomized, or Terminated, it is possible to exclude other users from seeing subjects with Screened status, while you could see all subjects.

ul.li: The task summary, count, and task summary pop-up at the study and site level only shows counts for subjects whose status you have permission to work with.
The subject list only shows subjects you have permission to work with.

Regular and
advanced subject search
only searches for subjects you have permission to access.
The last 10 subjects list only shows subjects you have permission to work with.

You can work on a subject whose status may change to a status you do not have permission to. The changes you make to the subject are saved to the database. However, once you exit the subject, you cannot access the subject again.

If subject status changes from a status you do not have permission to, to a status you have permission to
, the subject displays in the subject list and becomes available to you. The task summary, counts, and pop-up at the study and site level increases appropriately.
The Subject Status dropdown list in Advanced Search only shows subject statuses you have permission to work with.

ac:layout-cell.p: The Subject Schedule located on the Subject page lists patient visits. The Subject Schedule is read-only and enables you to schedule subsequent return visits. As forms are completed and submitted, the reference dates are automatically calculated and inserted into the Subject Schedule.

You cannot edit or delete the Subject Schedule. It is typically based on a date within the study that is assigned as the default calendar start date. The entry of the default calendar start date sets the subject calendar based on the days offset specified for each individual folder.
By default, the Subject Schedule is sorted by visit. It can also be sorted by visit and date.

ul.li: On the Subjectpage, click the Visit or Date column headings to sort the schedule by visit or date.

ac:layout-cell.p: The Subject Schedule displays the following information for the subject:

ul.li: Folder and Form links with status icons under the Visit column. The links direct you to the actual folder or form for the visit.

Date of the visit in preconfigured date format. Folder record date or form record date that is explicitly set from an edit check displays in bold text.Target dates for visits that have not occurred displays in gray. If there is no explicit record date or target date, no date displays.

ac:layout-cell.p:
Batch sign from the calendar view
. Click Sign and Save to sign in the signature pop-up window. Signing the subject signs all folders, forms, and data points for the subject requiring signature.

An existing form that is overwritten with the content of an existing draft form in Rave Architect has all changes from the draft applied to the published version. CRF data of subjects associated with the overwritten form can be updated by restoring a previously saved overwritten draft with a new draft in Rave Architect. However, during restoration, derivations and edit checks for the affected subjects do not automatically update. As a result, these affected subjects are rendered a status of 'In Doubt' in Rave EDC and marked with the
icon.
Subjects with 'In Doubt' status do not participate in the roll up process. Only subjects that do not have the 'In Doubt' status are rolled up and reflected in the corresponding study site.

ol.li: Navigate to a Study > Site that has 'In Doubt' subjects.

Click an 'In Doubt' subject whose edit checks and derivations you want to run.
The system rolls up the subject and the 'In Doubt' status goes away. You are directed to the Subjectpage.

ac:layout-cell.p:
A primary form is added to a study by default. You must complete the primary form prior to
adding a subject
to the site within a study. The fields on the primary form are used to derive the subject name within the study. The name and fields on the primary form are determined by the sponsor.

ul.li: Click Primary on the Subjectpage to view the form.

p.ac:placeholder: Update the below Macro to list all content labeled with your desired concept and the label 'task'.
Update the below Macro to list all content with your product's label, and 'concept'.

page.title: Adding and Modifying Template Forms in Rave EDC

ac:layout-cell.p:
A form can be configured as a template form. You can add, edit, and delete template forms by navigating to the Modify Template page from the form if you have the Can Modify Templates permission.
You can select and apply a template but cannot modify a template if you have the Can Use Templates permission. When you apply a template, all template fields and log fields are available for data entry. Data entry is unavailable only if the template is explicitly changed to another template or the form is reset back to its original state or overridden by an edit check.

ac:structured-macro.ac:rich-text-body: Note: A template form used as a primary form within a draft does not display the Template.

ac:layout-cell.h1: Applying a Template to a Template Form

ol.li:
Navigate to a Study > Site > Subject > a template form.
The template form includes a template dropdown that shows all available templates for the form across the site.

li.p: Select the desired template from the Template dropdown.

ac:structured-macro.ac:rich-text-body: Note: When a template is selected from the dropdown, an entry indicating the selection is written into the audit trail.

ol.li: Click Save.
Navigate to a Study > Site > Subject > a template form.

li.p:
Click Modify Template.
The Modify Template page displays a list of templates already created for the form.

ac:rich-text-body.p: Note: If no templates have been created for the current template form, the Modify Templates link displays but the dropdown is hidden. The dropdown displays only when templates are created for the current form.

ol.li: Click Add New.
Enter new template name.

Click update
.

Click
to select fields for the new template.
The form displays fields that are defined for the selected form, regardless of the default visible property settings.
Select the fields that you want to include in the new template.

ac:structured-macro.ac:rich-text-body: Note: Log fields on a form, if any, including the log header, and the ability to add and inactivate log lines only displays if there is at least one log field visible. The log field may be visible as a result of the field being part of a template or an edit check.

ol.li: Navigate to a Study > Site > Subject > a template form.

li.p:
Click Modify Template.
The Modify Template page displays a list of templates already created for the form.

ac:rich-text-body.p: Note: If no templates have been created for the current template form, the Modify Templates link displays but the dropdown is hidden. The dropdown displays only when templates are created for the current form.

ol.li: Select a template.

Click
to navigate to the template fields.
Select or deselect the fields to include or exclude from the template.

Click update
.

page.title: Modifying Local Lab Ranges in Rave EDC

ac:layout-cell.p: You can enter reference ranges for a lab on the Lab Maintenance page if you have the Use Lab Maintenance permission.

You can maintain valid lab ranges for a lab in the Lab Analyte Ranges page. The Lab Analyte Ranges page displays information on analyte name and units, including dynamic fields that are determined from the range type for the lab.

ac:structured-macro.ac:rich-text-body: Note: You cannot edit lab ranges, create new versions of lab ranges, or add new ranges for central labs in Rave EDC. Any central lab range is view-only.

ol.li: Navigate to a Study > Site > Subject > a lab form.
Select a lab from the dropdown list of labs.

Click Edit Ranges.
The Analyte Ranges page displays a list of all active ranges that are defined for the selected lab.

Click Add New Range
.
Complete the required fields.

Click Update
.
Rave EDC validates the data for the following criteria:
From Date must be less than To Date.
For variables with a low and a high value, the standard value for Low must be less than or equal to the standard value for High.
A variable value can be left blank if it is a character data type. For example, "Sex" may be blank to indicate both sexes. "From Age" cannot be blank.
Low value and High value are required unless a data dictionary is specified.
The range must not overlap with any other range. For example, a range for a sex of "Male" cannot overlap a range for a sex of "Female."
Note: For new and updated lab ranges, Rave EDC resets the Approved Flag for a lab to Unapproved.
Navigate to a Study > Site > Subject > a lab form.
Select a lab from the dropdown list of labs.

Click Edit Ranges.
The Analyte Ranges page displays a list of all active ranges that are defined for the selected lab.

Click Edit
next to the lab range you wish to edit or delete.
Edit the lab range as needed.

Click Update.
To delete the lab range, select Delete and click Update.
Navigate to a Study > Site > Subject > a lab form.
Select a lab from the dropdown list of labs.

Click Edit Ranges.
The Analyte Ranges page displays a list of all active ranges that are defined for the selected lab.

Click New Version
.
The new range version contains all data except the From and To dates. The date defaults to the current subject's visit date if you are maintaining the range in EDC. You may edit the value for From Date.

ac:layout-cell.h1: Modifying Lab Ranges after Data is Locked
ac:layout-cell.p: You can update lab ranges, such as changing a range's values, active dates, and so on, after data referencing the same lab is entered and locked in Rave EDC . Depending on your Rave configuration, you may or may not be able to update lab ranges if data that references the corresponding lab is locked.

By default, if a lab is selected on a form and its lab ranges are updated, the locked data will not be affected. You can update assuming you have the appropriate permissions to update lab ranges by way of the Lab Maintenance role permission.

Rave EDC may be configured to confirm that you have additional permissions in order to update lab ranges referenced by locked data points. In that case, Rave EDC allows you to update the lab ranges based on whether or not you can unlock locked data (by way of the Unlock role permission).

If you have the Lab Maintenance and Unlock role permissions and you attempt to save edits to lab ranges referenced by locked data, then the following occurs if the changes affect the data's out-of-range status:

ul.li: You receive a warning that the range is referenced by locked data. The message also mentions how many locked data points reference the range, including how you may may obtain details for the data from the Lab Clinical View. Typically, this data is accessible by a report or outputs specialist who works with Rave data.
If you click OK, the changes are made and the locked data points update accordingly within EDC. If you click Cancel, no changes are made, and the lab range modification is not saved.

Upon clicking OK, the lab range saves, and any locked data that referenced the modified lab range unlocks. Any signatures applied to that data are broken, and the data may require review, verification, freezing, and locking again, depending on the specific data’s requirements.

ac:layout-cell.p: If you have the Lab Maintenance role permission, but not the Unlock role permission, and you attempt to save edits to a lab range referenced by locked data, then:

ul.li: You receive a message that indicates you cannot modify the lab range because you do not have permission to unlock data. The message also mentions how many locked data points reference the range, including how you may obtain details for the data from the Lab Clinical View. Typically, this data is accessible to a report or outputs specialist who works with Rave data.
You can click OK to close the message. No changes are made to the lab range or to the data status in EDC.

p.ac:placeholder: Update the below Macro to list all content labeled with your desired concept and the label 'task'.
Update the below Macro to list all content with your product's label, and 'concept'.

ac:layout-cell.p:
A query is a question about a data point on a form that can be manually triggered or is triggered automatically by the system. When a query is added to a form, the query shows in the
Task Summary
. You can navigate to the query from the Task Summary. All associated activities with a query, such as, open, response, cancel, close, re-query, are recorded in the audit trail.

ac:rich-text-body.p: Note: A subject cannot be signed off until all associated open queries are closed.

ac:layout-cell.p: Queries consists of a text box and the option to require an explanation regarding the queried data. A query displays on the form page generally in pink or red, with a query message and the data entry field open for editing.
There are two query types:

ul.li: Manual Queries – Opens at the data point by a user, such as CRA or DM, to site personnel for clarification or correction on a submitted data point.

System Queries – Automatically generated by Rave EDC or a sponsor system when, for example, there is an issue with submitted data, a required field is left blank, or when a data point does not conform to a pre-configured edit check . A Rave EDC-generated query normally does not require a response. However, if a response is required, a user response text box or a dropdown displays.
The data field is highlighted and displays non-conformant
. A query message displays a data entry field open for editing. The query indicates the required data to clear the query.

ac:layout-cell.p: You can create a manual query at the data point if you have permissions.

ol.li: Navigate to a Study > Site > Subject > a form.

Click marking
to the right of the field you want to add a query.
Select Open Query from the dropdown of marking types.
Select an appropriate Marking Group.

Enter a comment up to 1000 characters in the text box or insert a markup tag using XML (Extensible Markup Language) that translates into either text or a link. For more information, see
Using XML in Markings
.
Require Response is selected by default. You may deselect if a response is not required.
Click Save.

ac:layout-cell.p: You can cancel a manual query if:

ul.li: The query does not require a response, or
No response is posted to a query that requires a response.

ol.li: Select Cancel for the Manual Query on the data form.

Click Save.
Rave EDC cancels the query and tracks the action in the audit trail.

ac:layout-cell.p: You can respond to queries in two ways:

ul.li: Modify the data in the data entry field. No additional response is required.
Include an additional response in the user response field. The response field may be free text or a Reasons dropdown.

ol.li: Navigate to a Study > Site > Subject > a form with an open query.
Make changes to the data as required.

li.p:
Click Save.
The answered query
displays. You can forward to authorized users who can close the query or re-query it.

ac:rich-text-body.p: Note: Forward Query is a configurable option that can be disabled at your request.
Note: An answered query can be closed. An unanswered open query can be cancelled, but cannot be closed.

ol.li: Navigate to a Study > Site > Subject > a form that has an answered query and is ready to be closed.
Select Close Query from the dropdown.
Click Save.

ac:layout-cell.p: A system query closes automatically when the data value is corrected.
If a system query is marked as requiring both a response and a manual close, you have two options:

ul.li: Correct the data value. The query requires no response to close. The response text box turns gray indicating that no response is required to close the query. Click Save. The query closes.

li.p:
Correct the data value and enter a response. Click Edit
and enter a response. Click Save. The query closes.

ol.li: Navigate to a Study > Site > Subject > a form that requires a re-query.

Select Re-Query from the dropdown.
An additional manual query appears with ‘Requires Response’ selected by default.

ac:layout-cell.p: You can forward both a manual query and a system query to any marking group if you have the Forward Query role action.

ac:rich-text-body.p: Note: A query can be opened to only one marking group at a time.

ol.li: Navigate to a Study > Site > Subject > a form that has a query placed on a field.
Click Forward.
Select a Marking Group from the dropdown.

Click Save.
Rave EDC forwards the query to the selected marking group.

p.ac:placeholder: Update the below Macro to list all content labeled with your desired concept and the label 'task'.
Update the below Macro to list all content with your product's label, and 'concept'.
